properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 1 at 12:52PM CST by NWS Memphis TN
properties.description:
The Flood Warning continues for the Tennessee River.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Tennessee River at Savannah
* until further notice.
* At 12 PM Wednesday the stage was 370.5 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring.
* Maximum forecast stage of 373.0 feet on Monday, January 6.
* Flood stage is 370.0 feet.
* Forecast to remain steady through Thursday afternoon then begin
rising through the weekend, cresting near 373.0 feet on Monday.
* At 371.0 feet...Federal Road is flooded at Lick Creek north of
Hamburg. Parts of Lacefield Drive are covered by flood water. At
372.0 feet, evacuation road from Big River Plantation Resort is
flooded. Most evacuation roads in bottom lands near Savannah are
inundated.
properties.instruction:
A followup Flood Statement will be issued Thursday morning or sooner
if conditions warrant.

For graphical river and flood information...please go to
www.weather.gov and click near Memphis on the map, then select Rivers
and Lakes.

Do not drive through flooded areas...turn around don't drown.

Stay tuned to your weather radio and your local news media for the
latest river information.
